newsitem.title: USA: U.S. did not provoke Baghdad shooting - Pentagon.
newsitem.headline: U.S. did not provoke Baghdad shooting - Pentagon.

text.p: U.S. forces did not provoke anti-aircraft firing in Baghdad on Wednesday, a U.S. defense official said.
"It's not us," the official said. "It's not precipitated by anything that U.S. forces are involved in."
The U.S. official was commenting on reports by witnesses in Baghdad that large explosions were heard there on Wednesday evening, along with heavy anti-aircraft fire.
Reporters in their offices said they heard about a dozen large explosions in Baghdad. The ground was shaking in some areas, a Reuters correspondent said.
The defence official in Washington said no U.S. planes had come under fire. He said the planes were staying in the no-fly zone south of Baghdad.
